title: thoughts and opinions please
body:
so yesterday I played a game (specificially a One for all game, where you all play the same champion) and I was matched with a premade of 3 and me and another solo player, I know they were a team of 3 because during the pre-game chat, during the game and the end game chat they all spammed racial slurs, religious hate speech and paedophilic references.( lynching x, doing things to children)  just plain toxicity and abuse

I know that when a player you report gets banned, you receive a message that the player has been banned, as I have not received even 1 message between these 3 players my assumption is they are still playing

why?

EDIT: never mind I think I figured it out, since it was just me and another solo player who I don't believe reported them, they just left straight after the game. the system just sees me reporting 3 players with no one else reporting them and ignores it as false reports from what I understand in the FAQ

replies.body: Only one report is needed to trigger a review and as Periscope said report weight is no longer a factor so a valid report will never be ignored. The notification is notoriously unreliable and *very* limited in when it shows. Not getting the notification doesn't mean no-one has been punished. Don't count on that notification, consider it a bonus and nothing more.

Report weight used to be a thing. It isn't anymore.

Given the situation you described, you should have marked "hate speech" with a note about the pre-game lobby.

You will not always receive the IFS message.

It's been mentioned a couple times already, but I just wanted to expand a little on the explanation.

The IFS notification doesn't always trigger as it should. Back when the system came out, it would only notify the most recent report prior to punishment, and even though it has "expanded" a bit and will now (occasionally) notify multiple reporters, it's (as Seras said) notoriously unreliable and will often notify only 1 player (and I reckon it does occasionally fail to notify anyone, based on some of the feedback and first-hand accounts about the notifications).

That isn’t how the system works. Unless you are consistently making false reports the system will check any reports you put in.  Also the number of reports doesn’t change a thing you can have 9 people report 1 person and it won’t change a thing, it’s the same as having 1 person report them. As for not getting a message saying they were banned this is a little old but I’m pretty sure it still applies it’s from deep terror Nami from the na boards “No, you can only receive the notification when your report is the one that triggers it. If the review and punishment is triggered in their next game you won't get it.”
